page.title: 20FOOTPATHS -THE VIKING WAY
page.content: There are many footpaths within the area.They form a network connecting farms and woodland.The longest one crossing the area is the Viking Way, which extends from the Humber Bridge to Oakham in Leicestershire. This path has been evolved by linking together existing public rights of way. In places it follows roads before again becoming a walk within the Countryside The path is marked with a Viking Helmet symbol which has been put on posts, stiles and gates along the way. A bridleway has opened from Croxton and this joins with the Viking Way on Race lane.An underpass has been built under the new A180 to allow this Bridleway to continue,and allow farmers access to their fields. This entry has been prepared by 6 members of the Kirmington and Croxton Womem's Institute.JS,ST,JP,DP,FW &UMV.
